meanings.sent1: The sighting of a shooting star was seen as an auspice of good luck.
meanings.sent2: The ancient oracle's words were considered an auspice of things to come.
meanings.sent3: The cat's purring was an auspice that it would be a peaceful evening.
meanings.sent4: The blooming of the first flower was an auspice of the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The rainbow after the storm served as an auspice of hope and renewal.

meanings.sent1: The local business provided auspice for the community event.
meanings.sent2: The king's auspice ensured the success of the artist's latest project.
meanings.sent3: The dog's wagging tail was an auspice of its loyalty to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's encouraging words acted as an auspice for the student's confidence.
meanings.sent5: The parent's presence at the game was an auspice of their unwavering support.

meanings.definition: Under the auspices of - with the help or support of
meanings.sent1: The charity event was organized under the auspice of the local council.
meanings.sent2: The research project was completed under the auspice of a renowned scientist.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was held under the auspice of clear blue skies.
meanings.sent4: The play was performed under the auspice of a full moon, adding to the magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The festival was celebrated under the auspice of joyful music and laughter.
